name: Etherington Hall
desc: Built in 1959, Etherington Hall houses the Departments of Medicine, Ophthalmology, Obstetrics and Gynaecology, and the Medical Art and Photography Service.
It is named after Frederick Etherington, a former Dean of Medicine and the husband of Agnes Etherington, who bequeathed the Agnes Etherington Art Centre building, their family home, to Queen's.
location: Etherington Hall is located on Stuart Street between Kingston General Hospital and Richardson Laboratory.
entrances:
North
The main entrance to Etherington Hall is not accessible.
corridors: There are doors that act as barriers in the corridors. These doors do not have operator buttons.
washrooms: Accessible washrooms are located on the lowest level near the auditorium and on level 1. Single user washrooms: 1002, 1003, 2002, 2003, 2008, 2018, 2026, 2052, 3014, 3017, 3027, 3045
classrooms: Check the classroom website for the accessibility of Etherington Hall classrooms.
elevators: The elevator is located near the auditorium on the lowest level of Etherington Hall. The elevator accesses all floors in the building. It is 74” wide and 94” long. The door opening is 44”. The elevator does not have an audible system nor is it mirrored.
parking: Permit parking is available in the lot behind McLaughlin Hall. There are two accessible meter spaces across the street from Etherington Hall. The Underground Parking Garage on Stuart Street at University Avenue offers permit and hourly parking and is accessible from Etherington Hall by a tunnel under Stuart Street.
